key_title: Key to the species of Acrotriche

source.author: Albrecht, D.E.
source.title: Epacridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Albrecht, D.E. (1996). Epacridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Subparallel veins closest to the margin on the underside of leaves with lateral veins radiating to the margin; ovary glabrous or pubescent
All subparallel veins on the underside of leaves lacking lateral veins; ovary densely covered with minute white hairs
Leaf apex with a pungent apical mucro
Leaf apex with a blunt callus tip
Flowers in c. 3–14-flowered spikes less than 10 mm long; at least some leaves longer than 5 mm
Flowers in c. 15–30-flowered spikes 15–30 mm long; leaves 1.5–5 mm long
Spreading shrub c. 30–130 cm high, stems not rooting; corolla tube less than 3 mm long; ovary and fruit glabrous
Prostrate to decumbent shrub to c. 15 cm high, stems rooting; corolla tube more than 5 mm long; ovary and fruit pubescent

Underside of leaves pale green, the veins separated by very narrow deep grooves; leaves glabrous or scabrous towards base on upper side, margins smooth to scabrous-ciliolate, hairs less than 0.2 mm long; style 0.7–1.3 mm long

Underside of leaves grey, the veins separated by shallow, comparatively broader grooves; leaves with few to many hairs of variable length (but more than 0.2 mm long) on the upper and lower surfaces and margins
